attributes.comment: Reject this proposal: I requested a female doctor to check and remove suspicious moles, as I have had one test pre-cancerous in the past. The doctor came in with a male intern, breezily asked if I minded while he, a large, muscular man looked straight in my eyes about three feet from me. It was an unfair spot to put me in, and I felt I had no choice. Several spots were removed for testing and when I left the office, I realized I had not told the doctor about the spots below my waist, as showing the ones on my bra line tested my modesty well-beyond my comfort level. So, I had to return for a second appointment, which was aborted due to doctor running out of time, though I'm sure they charged for it, and I had to book a 3rd appointment to address the suspicious moles below my waist. THREE appointments instead of one because a male intern was present. A male who chooses to present as if he is a woman, or a male who uses the opportunity of 'self-ID' to gain access to undressed women and girls, to have authority in a doctor's office to say "remove your clothes," or to look at, touch, bathe, toilet a woman, is not okay with me, nor with most PEOPLE to be hired 'as a woman' with rights and privileges accorded thereon. I have always preferred women doctors, especially for gynecological exams, as only another woman KNOWS for sure how it feels to have medical instruments used for this purpose. I have stopped a gyno exam the moment one male doctor shoved in the speculum, as it was clearly deliberately sudden and rough: the behavior of a sadist. I demanded immediate removal of the speculum, sat up and said, "This appointment is over, you are a sadist, and I am never coming back here again." Allowing men whatever they call themselves to impersonate women in positions of trust is wrong, devious and calculated evil. Wash the nation's hands of this scheme.
